Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; on far right, part of lotus flower in faded added white outline and added red centre; below, two white bands; exterior: dot and billet band at rim above broken maeander pattern between pairs of lines; below: on left, pendant triangle and pendant corner ornament; on right, dividing band of vertical maeander pattern.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices as the sherd displays patterns similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72). The presence of interior decoration suggests that the sherd is late in the Wild Goat Style and may mark a transition to the Mature Animal Style.
'AΠ' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 11)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 234, no. 127)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0397) (phase 2)
